definition: to jump from a building (to kill oneself)/fig. to sell at a large discount (in advertising)
to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
surname Lou
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
extremely low price/knockdown price

sentences.english: Jumped to his four-row, strongly recommends that you choose to brave the sea to see the other side.
sentences.chinese: 跳楼机分四排，强烈建议勇敢的你选择看海的那一边。

sentences.english: The kidnapper is yulia tutor, see his jump off a building suicide.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪是尤丽亚的家教老师，见事情败露便跳楼自尽。

sentences.english: The free-fall ride is a very excitive machine.
sentences.chinese: 跳楼机是个非常刺激的机器。

sentences.english: A high-salary woman tried to jump off a building, just because she can't find her Mr.
sentences.chinese: 有位高薪水的女人因找不到适合的男人差点跳楼？

sentences.english: If I jumped off the building, would you do the same?
sentences.chinese: 如果我现在跳楼，你也会跳下去吗？

sentences.english: Compared with my experience, did any skilled immigrant have reason to jump from high-rise?
sentences.chinese: 请问还有哪个技术移民有理由跳楼？

sentences.english: in the latest case, a 21-year-old threw himself off a building in late July.
sentences.chinese: 最近的一次是一个21岁的员工在7月底跳楼身亡。

sentences.english: One day I got a call, for a jumper.
sentences.chinese: 一天我接到个电话，一个人想跳楼自杀。

sentences.english: Shortly after he was questioned, Mr. Sun jumped from the 12th floor of an apartment building and died.
sentences.chinese: 在被保安质问后不久，孙从宿舍12楼跳楼自杀。

sentences.english: Two other workers attempted to kill themselves by jumping off buildings but survived.
sentences.chinese: 此外，还有两名工人跳楼自杀，但大难不死。

sentences.english: Sorry even if offered at cut throat price, we wont buy it.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，即使给了一个跳楼价，我们也不会买它。

sentences.english: You love a girl, but she don't do you, even like to jump down the building.
sentences.chinese: 你喜欢一个女孩，但是她对你不来电，甚至要跳楼。

sentences.english: Seven of those injured were taken to hospital for emergency treatment.
sentences.chinese: 跳楼伤者中有7人被送医抢救。

sentences.english: In February, a bank employee committed suicide by leaping from a building in Hong Kong's Central district.
sentences.chinese: 在二月，一名银行职员从香港中心区的高楼跳楼自杀。

sentences.english: Let me assume that it wraps around the jumper to make a cylindrical shape. Here is sketch.
sentences.chinese: 让我们假设这些纸将跳楼者围起来形成一个圆柱形。

sentences.english: During one quarrel Tan threatened to jump off their flat.
sentences.chinese: 在一次争吵中，谭璐威胁说她要跳楼。

definition: to fall off or jump off a building
a suicide/to commit suicide
to drown oneself by jumping into the river
to kill oneself/to commit suicide/to attempt suicide
to commit suicide
to fall to one's death
cannot figure out/to be unable to take a lighter view/to take things too hard/to be depressed/to fret over trifles
to hang oneself
to fall to one's death
to lie across the railway tracks (to commit suicide or to prevent trains from getting through)
to attempt suicide/to court death
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
top of a building
to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
sudden death (in medicine, sporting competitions etc)
to take poison
